author: Grumblesnake

text:
This was the first game I ever Plat'd, and for good reason.  I do have to agree with the masses when they claim that the game is too short, but I believe this is a good thing, for it leaves us wanting more!

The music was nothing short of epic; it was a blend of mariachi and dance that gave the game energy while instilling the proper atmosphere.  Definitely worthy of an entry into SD's collection!

text:
WAIT WAIT WAIT WAIT WAIT!

I thought this was a super meat boy style type platformer thing because I'd never actually looked up on it, not a metroidvania! It's a metroidvania, it's Mexican and it's a 2 player?
YOU HAVE NO IDEA HOW PERFECT THIS IS TO ME!
author: matt036

text: They didn't intend for it to be taken seriously, in name or any other aspect of style. Though it's not all really simple bad puns and stuff, they have legitimate folklore influences in there, or so they say.
author: DiiNovensiles

text: This is one of those games that I'm pretty conflicted about trying. Metroidvania got me interested too, but it looks a bit too... simple hack and slash for a metroidvania for me.
author: DiiNovensiles

text: I just bought this game, played it a bit and I'm sure I'll be having some great fun. The game's description had me at "Metroidvania". The whole Mexican/luchadore setting is also very fresh. The humor seems great and I like how there are many references (for example, the statue in the picture being a direct homage to the Metroid series). The soundtrack is fittingly awesome too!
author: SupraDarky
